article.title: Infrared dynamics of massive scalars from the complementary series in de Sitter space

multiple_choice_question.text: This formula describes the behavior of Bessel functions, which represent free scalar modes in the expanding Poincaré patch of de Sitter space. What does the variable `pη` represent in this context?
This formula represents the second-loop correction to the Keldysh propagator in a λφ⁴ theory. What type of Feynman diagram is responsible for the dominant contribution to this correction?
This formula defines a condition on the mass of a scalar field in de Sitter space. What kind of potentially dangerous IR corrections might arise when this condition is violated?

This integro-differential equation describes the resummation of leading secular IR corrections for the Keldysh propagator. What is the key difference between this equation and its counterpart for the principal series case?
choices: It has a clear kinetic/particle interpretation
It does not oscillate at future infinity
